headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Tuesday
headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Fared on Tuesday

docs.snippet: U.S. stocks drifted mostly lower Tuesday, led by declines in energy stocks as the price of oil dropped for a fifth day in a row. The Dow Jones industrial average had its fourth straight gain....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. stocks drifted mostly lower Tuesday, led by declines in energy stocks as the price of oil dropped for a fifth day in a row. The Dow Jones industrial average had its fourth straight gain.

headline.main: Hungary's Krasznahorkai Wins Man Booker International Prize
headline.print_headline: Hungary's Krasznahorkai Wins Man Booker International Prize

docs.snippet: Hungarian writer Laszlo Krasznahorkai has won the Man Booker International Prize for what the judges said were "magnificent works of deep imagination and complex passions, in which the human comedy verges painfully onto transcendence"....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hungarian writer Laszlo Krasznahorkai has won the Man Booker International Prize for what the judges said were "magnificent works of deep imagination and complex passions, in which the human comedy verges painfully onto transcendence".

headline.main: Iowa Capitol Evacuated for Burnt Pizza Crust
headline.print_headline: Iowa Capitol Evacuated for Burnt Pizza Crust

docs.snippet: Weeks after burned macaroni and cheese emptied out the Iowa Capitol, a charred pizza crust has done it again....
docs.lead_paragraph: Weeks after burned macaroni and cheese emptied out the Iowa Capitol, a charred pizza crust has done it again.

headline.main: Boehner: Obama Should Draft Second Version of New War Powers
headline.print_headline: Boehner: Obama Should Draft Second Version of New War Powers

docs.snippet: House Speaker John Boehner says President Barack Obama should scrap his draft of new war powers to fight Islamic State militants and send a new one to Congress....
docs.lead_paragraph: House Speaker John Boehner says President Barack Obama should scrap his draft of new war powers to fight Islamic State militants and send a new one to Congress.

headline.main: Hungarian Writer Krasznahorkai Wins Man Booker Intl Prize

headline.main: Los Angeles Becomes Latest US City to Favor $15 Minimum Wage
headline.print_headline: Los Angeles Becomes Latest US City to Favor $15 Minimum Wage

docs.snippet: The Los Angeles City Council has voted to raise the minimum wage in the city to $15 an hour by 2020, making it the largest city in the nation to do so....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles City Council has voted to raise the minimum wage in the city to $15 an hour by 2020, making it the largest city in the nation to do so.

headline.main: Owner: Burglary of St. Louis Shop Nets $10, Ruins Chocolate
headline.print_headline: Owner: Burglary of St. Louis Shop Nets $10, Ruins Chocolate

docs.snippet: The owner of a landmark, century-old St. Louis ice cream and candy emporium says burglars of his business made off with about $10 in coins. But the loss to the business is far more....
docs.lead_paragraph: The owner of a landmark, century-old St. Louis ice cream and candy emporium says burglars of his business made off with about $10 in coins. But the loss to the business is far more.

headline.main: To Heel or Not to Heel, That Is the Cannes Question
headline.print_headline: To Heel or Not to Heel, That Is the Cannes Question

docs.snippet: Perhaps not since Cinderella lost a glass slipper at the ball has there been such a stir about glamorous footwear as there was on Tuesday in Cannes over a report that women had been turned away from a film premiere for failing to wear heels....
docs.lead_paragraph: Perhaps not since Cinderella lost a glass slipper at the ball has there been such a stir about glamorous footwear as there was on Tuesday in Cannes over a report that women had been turned away from a film premiere for failing to wear heels.

headline.main: Montana Teen Fatally Shoots Friend in Case of Mistaken Identity, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Montana Teen Fatally Shoots Friend in Case of Mistaken Identity, Police Say

docs.snippet: A Montana teenager fatally shot his 15-year-old friend after mistaking him for an intruder when the boy threw a rock at his bedroom window in the predawn hours and then stuck his head through it, police said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Montana teenager fatally shot his 15-year-old friend after mistaking him for an intruder when the boy threw a rock at his bedroom window in the predawn hours and then stuck his head through it, police said on Tuesday.
